intro: Oxylobium pulteneae, commonly known as the yellow sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Oxylobium pulteneae is an important plant for pollinators and is valued for its ecological role in desert ecosystems.
